com.netspective.sparx.xif.db
Interface DatabaseContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDatabaseContext
public interface DatabaseContext

Provides an interface for obtaining a default or named JDBC Connection object; the implementations of this interface should manage connection pooling.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Shahid N. Shah

Field Detail

RESULTSET_NOT_SCROLLABLE

public static final int RESULTSET_NOT_SCROLLABLE
Method Detail

getDatabasePolicy

public DatabasePolicy getDatabasePolicy(java.sql.Connection conn)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
Given a connection, return the DatabasePolicy object for the specific database.

translateDataSourceId

public java.lang.String translateDataSourceId(com.netspective.sparx.util.value.ValueContext vc,
                                              java.lang.String dataSourceId)
Given a data source identifier, translate the name to a suitable name for the given ValueContext. For example, if the dataSourceId is null, return the default dataSource. If any per-user or per-request dataSourceId name changes are needed, override this method.

getConnection

public java.sql.Connection getConnection(java.lang.String dataSourceId)
                                  throws javax.naming.NamingException,
                                         java.sql.SQLException
Returns a connection (with appropriate pooling) for the given dataSourceId (no datasource translation performed)

getConnection

public java.sql.Connection getConnection(com.netspective.sparx.util.value.ValueContext vc,
                                         java.lang.String dataSourceId)
                                  throws javax.naming.NamingException,
                                         java.sql.SQLException
Returns a connection (with appropriate pooling) for the given dataSourceId. Datasource translation is performed by using the translateDataSourceId() method (e.g. null dataSource is the "default" data source).

getScrollableResultSetType

public int getScrollableResultSetType(com.netspective.sparx.util.value.ValueContext vc,
                                      java.lang.String dataSourceId)
                               throws javax.naming.NamingException,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
Returns the ResultSet type (scrollabe, non-scrollable) for a given dataSourceId. This method is preferred over Connection.getResultSetType because many JDBC 2.0 drivers purport to support but are buggy so this method allows the opportunity to force an otherwise scrollable result set to be non-scrollable.

getScrollableResultSetType

public int getScrollableResultSetType(java.sql.Connection connection)
                               throws javax.naming.NamingException,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
Returns the ResultSet type (scrollabe, non-scrollable) for a given connection. This method is preferred over Connection.getResultSetType because many JDBC 2.0 drivers purport to support but are buggy so this method allows the opportunity to force an otherwise scrollable result set to be non-scrollable.

createCatalog

public void createCatalog(com.netspective.sparx.util.value.ValueContext vc,
                          org.w3c.dom.Element parent)
                   throws javax.naming.NamingException
Creates catalog of dataSource identifiers and drivers for ACE Data Source tab.
